  136: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  137:     _ = end_per_suite(Config0),
  138:     try crypto:start() of
  139: 	ok ->
  140: 	    %% Currently no ct function available for is_cover!
  141: 	    case test_server:is_cover() of
  142: 		false ->
  143: 		    Config = add_ssl_opts_config(Config0),
  144: 		    setup_certs(Config),
  145: 		    Config;
  146: 		true ->
  147: 		    {skip, "Can not be covered"}
  148: 	    end
  149:     catch _:_ ->
  150: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
  151:     end.
  152: 
  153: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  154:     application:stop(crypto).
  155: 
  156: 
  157: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  158:     try init_per_tc(Case, Config)
  159:     catch
  160:         Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
  161:             {fail, {Class, Reason, Stacktrace}}
  162:     end.
  163: 
  164: init_per_tc(embedded, Config) ->
  165:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  166:     case
  167:         lists:all(
  168:           fun ({App,_,VSN}) ->
  169:                   filelib:is_dir(
  170:                     filename:join(
  171:                       LibDir, atom_to_list(App)++"-"++VSN))
  172:           end, application_controller:which_applications())
  173:     of
  174:         false ->
  175:             {skip, "Must be run from a real Erlang installation"};
  176:         true ->
  177:             Config
  178:     end;
  179: init_per_tc(Case, Config)
  180:   when Case =:= ktls_verify, is_list(Config) ->
  181:     case ktls_encrypt_decrypt(false) of
  182:         ok ->
  183:             common_init(Case, Config);
  184:         Skip ->
  185:             Skip
  186:     end;
  187: %%
  188: init_per_tc(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  189:     common_init(Case, Config).
  190: 
  191: common_init(Case, Config) ->
  192:     ct:timetrap({seconds, ?DEFAULT_TIMETRAP_SECS}),
  193:     [{testcase, Case}|Config].
  194: 
  195: end_per_testcase(_, _Config) ->
  196:     ok.

  202: basic() ->

  207: embedded() ->
  208:     [{doc,"Test that two nodes can connect via ssl distribution in embedded mode"}].
  209: embedded(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  210:     ReleaseDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config), "embedded"),
  211:     EbinDir = filename:join(ReleaseDir,"ebin/"),
  212: 
  213:     %% Create an application for the test modules
  214:     Modules = [ssl_dist_test_lib, ?MODULE],
  215:     App = {application, tls_test,
  216:            [{description, "Erlang/OTP SSL test application"},
  217:             {vsn, "1.0"},
  218:             {modules, Modules},
  219:             {registered,[]},
  220:             {applications, [kernel, stdlib]}]},
  221:     ok = filelib:ensure_path(EbinDir),
  222:     [{ok,_} = file:copy(code:which(Mod), filename:join(EbinDir, atom_to_list(Mod)++".beam"))
  223:      || Mod <- Modules],
  224:     ok = file:write_file(filename:join(EbinDir,"tls_test.app"),
  225:                          io_lib:format("~p.",[App])),
  226: 
  227:     %% Create a release that we can boot from
  228:     Rel = {release, {"tls","1.0"}, {erts, get_app_vsn(erts)},
  229:            [{tls_test, "1.0"},
  230:             {kernel, get_app_vsn(kernel)},
  231:             {stdlib, get_app_vsn(stdlib)},
  232:             {public_key, get_app_vsn(public_key)},
  233:             {asn1, get_app_vsn(asn1)},
  234:             {sasl, get_app_vsn(sasl)},
  235:             {crypto, get_app_vsn(crypto)},
  236:             {ssl, get_app_vsn(ssl)}]},
  237:     TlsRel = filename:join(ReleaseDir, "tls"),
  238:     ok = file:write_file(TlsRel ++ ".rel", io_lib:format("~p.",[Rel])),
  239:     code:add_patha(EbinDir),
  240:     ok = systools:make_script(TlsRel),
  241:     ok = systools:script2boot(TlsRel),
  242: 
  243:     %% Start two nodes in embedded mode and make sure they can connect
  244:     %% There used to be a bug here where crypto was not loaded early enough
  245:     %% for the distributed connection to work.
  246:     NodeConfig = [{app_opts, "-boot "++TlsRel++" -mode embedded -pa "++EbinDir++" "} | Config],
  247:     Node1 = peer:random_name(),
  248:     Node2 = peer:random_name(),
  249: 
  250:     NH1 = start_ssl_node([{node_name,Node1}|NodeConfig]),
  251:     %% The second node does `sync_nodes_mandatory` with the first in order for
  252:     %% a connection to be established very early in the boot sequence
  253:     ok = file:write_file(
  254:            filename:join(ReleaseDir,"node2.config"),
  255:            io_lib:format(
  256:              "~p.",[[{kernel,
  257:                       [{sync_nodes_timeout,infinity},
  258:                        {sync_nodes_mandatory,
  259:                         [list_to_atom(Node1++"@"++inet_db:gethostname())]}]}]])),
  260:     NH2 = start_ssl_node([{node_name,Node2}|NodeConfig],
  261:                          " -config " ++ filename:join(ReleaseDir,"node2")),
  262: 
  263:     try
  264:         basic_test(NH1, NH2, Config)
  265:     catch
  266: 	_:Reason ->
  267: 	    stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  268: 	    stop_ssl_node(NH2),
  269: 	    ct:fail(Reason)
  270:     end,
  271:     stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  272:     stop_ssl_node(NH2),
  273:     success(Config).
  274: 
  275: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  276: ktls_encrypt_decrypt() ->
  277:     [{doc,"Test that kTLS encryption offloading works"}].
  278: ktls_encrypt_decrypt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  279:     ktls_encrypt_decrypt(true);
  280: %%
  281: %%  ktls_encrypt_decrypt(false) is used by init_per_tc(ktls_verify, _)
  282: %%
  283: ktls_encrypt_decrypt(Test) when is_boolean(Test) ->
  284:     %%
  285:     %% We need a connected socket
  286:     {ok, Listen} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active, false}]),
  287:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(Listen),
  288:     {ok, Client} =
  289:         gen_tcp:connect({127,0,0,1}, Port, [{active, false}]),
  290:     {ok, Server} = gen_tcp:accept(Listen),
  291:     try
  292:         maybe
  293:             {ok, OS} ?= ssl_test_lib:ktls_os(),
  294:             ok ?= ssl_test_lib:ktls_set_ulp(Client, OS),
  295:             ok ?= ssl_test_lib:ktls_set_cipher(Client, OS, tx, 11),
  296:             case Test of
  297:                 false ->
  298:                     ok;
  299:                 true ->
  300:                     ktls_encrypt_decrypt(Client, Server)
  301:             end
  302:         else
  303:             {error, Reason} ->
  304:                 {skip, Reason}
  305:         end
  306:     after
  307:         _ = gen_tcp:close(Server),
  308:         _ = gen_tcp:close(Client),
  309:         _ = gen_tcp:close(Listen)
  310:     end.
  311: 
  312: ktls_encrypt_decrypt(Client, Server) ->
  313:     %%
  314:     %% Test to transfer encrypted data,
  315:     %% and also to not activate RX encryption and transfer data.
  316:     %%
  317:     Data = "The quick brown fox jumps over a lazy dog 0123456789",
  318:     %%
  319:     %% Send encrypted from Client before Server has activated decryption
  320:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Client, Data),
  321:     receive after 500 -> ok end, % Give time for data to arrive
  322:     %%
  323:     %% Activate Server TX encryption
  324:     {ok, OS} = ssl_test_lib:ktls_os(),
  325:     ok = ssl_test_lib:ktls_set_ulp(Server, OS),
  326:     ok = ssl_test_lib:ktls_set_cipher(Server, OS, tx, 17),
  327:     %% Send encrypted from Server
  328:     ok = gen_tcp:send(Server, Data),
  329:     %% Receive encrypted data without decryption
  330:     case gen_tcp:recv(Client, 0, 1000) of
  331:         {ok, Data} ->
  332:             ct:fail(recv_cleartext_data);
  333:         {ok, RandomData} when length(Data) < length(RandomData) ->
  334:             ?CT_LOG("Received ~p", [RandomData]),
  335:             %% A TLS block should be longer than Data
  336:             ok
  337:     end,
  338:     %% Finally, activate Server decryption
  339:     ok = ssl_test_lib:ktls_set_cipher(Server, OS, rx, 11),
  340:     %% Receive and decrypt the data that was first sent
  341:     {ok, Data} = gen_tcp:recv(Server, 0, 1000),
  342:     ok.
  343: 
  344: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  345: ktls_verify() ->
  346:     [{doc,
  347:       "Test that two nodes can connect via ssl distribution over kTLS"}].
  348: ktls_verify(Config) ->
  349:     KTLSOpts = "-ssl_dist_opt "
  350:         "client_versions tlsv1.3 "
  351:         "server_versions tlsv1.3 "
  352:         "client_ciphers TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 "
  353:         "server_ciphers TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384 "
  354:         "client_ktls true "
  355:         "server_ktls true ",
  356:     KTLSConfig = [{tls_verify_opts, KTLSOpts} | Config],
  357:     gen_dist_test(
  358:       fun (NH1, NH2) ->
  359:               basic_test(NH1, NH2, KTLSConfig),
  360:               0 = ktls_count_tls_dist(NH1),
  361:               0 = ktls_count_tls_dist(NH2),
  362:               ok
  363:       end, KTLSConfig).
  364: 
  365: %% Verify that kTLS was activated (whitebox verification);
  366: %% check that a specific supervisor has no child supervisor
  367: %% which indicates that ssl_gen_statem:ktls_handover/1 has succeeded
  368: %%
  369: ktls_count_tls_dist(Node) ->
  370:     Key = supervisors,
  371:     case
  372:         lists:keyfind(
  373:           Key, 1,
  374:           apply_on_ssl_node(
  375:             Node, supervisor, count_children,
  376:             [tls_dist_connection_sup]))
  377:     of
  378:         {Key, N} ->
  379:             N;
  380:         false ->
  381:             0
  382:     end.
  383:

  395: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  396: dist_port_overload() ->
  397:     [{doc, "Test that TLS distribution connections can be accepted concurrently"}].
  398: dist_port_overload(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  399:     (RequiredConcurrency = 2) =< erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)
  400:         orelse
  401:         throw({skip, "Not enough schedulers online"}),
  402:     %%
  403:     %% Start a node, and get the port number it's listening on.
  404:     #node_handle{nodename = NodeName} = NH1 = start_ssl_node(Config),
  405:     [Name, Host] = string:lexemes(atom_to_list(NodeName), "@"),
  406:     {ok, NodesPorts} = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun net_adm:names/0),
  407:     {Name, Port} = lists:keyfind(Name, 1, NodesPorts),
  408:     %% Run RequiredConcurrency connections concurrently.
  409:     %% When TLS handshake is not concurrent,
  410:     %% and with default net_setuptime of 7 seconds,
  411:     %% only one connection per 7 seconds is closed from server side.
  412:     %% With concurrent accept they will be closed in parallel.
  413:     Started = [connect(self(), Host, Port) || _ <- lists:seq(1, RequiredConcurrency)],
  414:     %% give 10 seconds (more than 7, less than 2x7 seconds)
  415:     Responded = barrier(RequiredConcurrency, [], erlang:system_time(millisecond) + 10000),
  416:     %% clean up
  417:     stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  418:     [R ! exit || R <- Responded],
  419:     [exit(P, kill) || P <- Started -- Responded],
  420:     %% Ensure some amount of concurrency was reached.
  421:     (length(Responded) >= RequiredConcurrency) orelse
  422:         ct:fail({actual, length(Responded), expected, RequiredConcurrency}),
  423:     success(Config).
  424: 
  425: barrier(0, Responded, _Until) ->
  426:     Responded;
  427: barrier(RequiredConcurrency, Responded, Until) ->
  428:     Timeout = Until - erlang:system_time(millisecond),
  429:     receive
  430:         {waiting, Pid} ->
  431:             barrier(RequiredConcurrency - 1, [Pid | Responded], Until);
  432:         {error, Error} ->
  433:             ct:fail(Error)
  434:     after
  435:         Timeout -> Responded
  436:     end.
  437: 
  438: connect(Control, Host, Port) ->
  439:     spawn(
  440:         fun () ->
  441:             case gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [{active, true}]) of
  442:                 {ok, Sock} ->
  443:                     receive
  444:                         {tcp_closed, Sock} ->
  445:                             Control ! {waiting, self()};
  446:                         exit ->
  447:                             gen_tcp:close(Sock)
  448:                     end;
  449:                 Error ->
  450:                     Control ! {error, Error}
  451:             end
  452:         end).
  453:

  492: listen_port_options() ->
  493:     [{doc, "Test specifying listening ports"}].
  494: listen_port_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  495:     %% Set up the probably most supported scenario
  496:     %% for {reuseaddr,true}, i.e, the listening socket
  497:     %% is closed, but an accepted server side socket
  498:     %% blocks the server port, unless {reuseaddr,true}
  499:     %% is used.
  500:     %%
  501:     %% Set up a server socket and close the listening socket
  502:     {ok, L}    = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{reuseaddr,true}]),
  503:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
  504:     {ok, C}    = gen_tcp:connect({127,0,0,1}, Port, []),
  505:     {ok, S}    = gen_tcp:accept(L),
  506:     ok         = gen_tcp:close(L),
  507:     ?CT_LOG("Port: ~w", [Port]),
  508:     %%
  509:     %% Start a node on the server port, {reuseaddr,true}
  510:     %% is used per default on the listening socket
  511:     %% since it is a server - see inet_tcp_dist:gen_listen/3
  512:     PortOpts =
  513:         "-kernel"
  514:         " inet_dist_listen_min " ++ integer_to_list(Port) ++
  515:         " inet_dist_listen_max " ++ integer_to_list(Port),
  516:     %% basic_test/3 connects NH1 -> NH2 so it is NH2 that should
  517:     %% act as server to make use of PortOpts
  518:     NH1 = start_ssl_node(Config),
  519:     NH2 = start_ssl_node(Config, PortOpts),
  520:     try
  521:         basic_test(NH1, NH2, Config),
  522:         Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  523:         {ok,NodeInfo2} =
  524:             apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, net_kernel, node_info, [Node2]),
  525:         {address,#net_address{address = {_,Port}, protocol = tls}} =
  526:             lists:keyfind(address, 1, NodeInfo2),
  527:         ok
  528:     after
  529:         gen_tcp:close(C),
  530:         gen_tcp:close(S),
  531:         stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  532:         stop_ssl_node(NH2)
  533:     end.

  557: use_interface() ->
  558:     [{doc, "Test inet_dist_use_interface"}].
  559: use_interface(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  560:     %% Force the node to listen only on the loopback interface.
  561:     IpString = localhost_ipstr(inet_ver()),
  562:     Options = "-kernel inet_dist_use_interface " ++ IpString,
  563: 
  564:     %% Start a node, and get the port number it's listening on.
  565:     NH1 = start_ssl_node([{tls_verify_opts, Options} | Config]),
  566:   
  567:     try
  568: 	Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
  569: 	Name = lists:takewhile(fun(C) -> C =/= $@ end, atom_to_list(Node1)),
  570: 	{ok, NodesPorts} = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun net_adm:names/0),
  571: 	{Name, Port} = lists:keyfind(Name, 1, NodesPorts),
  572: 	
  573: 	%% Now find the socket listening on that port, and check its sockname.
  574: 	Sockets = apply_on_ssl_node(
  575: 		    NH1,
  576: 		    fun() ->
  577: 			    [inet:sockname(P) ||
  578: 				P <- inet_ports(),
  579: 				{ok, Port} =:= (catch inet:port(P))]
  580: 		    end),
  581: 	%% And check that it's actually listening on localhost.
  582:         IP = localhost_ip(inet_ver()),
  583:         [{ok,{IP,Port}}] = Sockets
  584:     catch 
  585: 	_:Reason ->
  586: 	    stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  587: 	    ct:fail(Reason)
  588:     end,
  589:     stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  590:     success(Config).
  591: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  592: verify_fun_fail() ->
  593:     [{doc,"Test specifying verify_fun with a function that always fails"}].
  594: verify_fun_fail(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  595:       AddTLSVerifyOpts = "-ssl_dist_opt "
  596:         "server_verify_fun "
  597: 	"\"{ssl_dist_SUITE,verify_fail_always,{}}\" "
  598:         "client_verify_fun "
  599: 	"\"{ssl_dist_SUITE,verify_fail_always,{}}\" ",
  600:     gen_dist_test(verify_fun_fail_test, [{tls_verify_opts, AddTLSVerifyOpts} | Config]).

  619:     NH1 = start_ssl_node(Config, "-epmd_module " ++ atom_to_list(?MODULE)),
  620:     NH2 = start_ssl_node(Config, "-epmd_module " ++ atom_to_list(?MODULE)),

  664: gen_dist_test(Test, Config) ->
  665:     NH1 = start_ssl_node(Config),
  666:     NH2 = start_ssl_node(Config),
  667:     try
  668:         if
  669:             is_atom(Test) ->
  670:                 ?MODULE:Test(NH1, NH2, Config);
  671:             is_function(Test, 2) ->
  672:                 Test(NH1, NH2)
  673:         end
  674:     catch
  675: 	Class:Reason:Stacktrace ->
  676: 	    ct:fail({Class,Reason,Stacktrace})
  677:     after
  678:         stop_ssl_node(NH1),
  679:         stop_ssl_node(NH2)
  680:     end,
  681:     success(Config).

  686: try_setting_priority(TestFun, Config) ->
  687:     Prio = 1,
  688:     case gen_udp:open(0, [{priority,Prio}]) of
  689: 	{ok,Socket} ->
  690: 	    case inet:getopts(Socket, [priority]) of
  691: 		{ok,[{priority,Prio}]} ->
  692: 		    ok = gen_udp:close(Socket),
  693: 		    TestFun(Prio, Config);
  694: 		_ ->
  695: 		    ok = gen_udp:close(Socket),
  696: 		    {skip,
  697: 		     "Can not set priority "++integer_to_list(Prio)++
  698: 			 " on socket"}
  699: 	    end;
  700: 	{error,_} ->
  701: 	    {skip, "Can not set priority on socket"}
  702:     end.

  704: basic_test(NH1, NH2, _) ->
  705:     Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
  706:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  707:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  708:     [Node2] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> nodes() end),
  709:     [Node1] = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> nodes() end),
  710: 
  711:     verify_tls(NH1, NH2),
  712: 
  713:     %% The test_server node has the same cookie as the ssl nodes
  714:     %% but it should not be able to communicate with the ssl nodes
  715:     %% via the erlang distribution.
  716:     pang = net_adm:ping(Node1),
  717:     pang = net_adm:ping(Node2),
  718: 
  719:     %% SSL nodes should not be able to communicate with the test_server node
  720:     %% either (and ping should return eventually).
  721:     TestServer = node(),
  722:     pang = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(TestServer) end),
  723:     pang = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> net_adm:ping(TestServer) end),
  724: 
  725:     %%
  726:     %% Check that we are able to communicate over the erlang
  727:     %% distribution between the ssl nodes.
  728:     %%
  729:     Ref = make_ref(),
  730:     spawn(fun () ->
  731: 		  apply_on_ssl_node(
  732: 		    NH1,
  733: 		    fun () ->
  734: 			    tstsrvr_format(
  735:                               "Hi from ~p!~n", [node()]),
  736: 			    send_to_tstcntrl(
  737:                               {Ref, self()}),
  738: 			    receive
  739: 				{From, ping} ->
  740: 				    tstsrvr_format(
  741:                                       "Received ping ~p!~n", [node()]),
  742: 				    From ! {self(), pong}
  743: 			    end
  744: 		    end)
  745: 	  end),
  746:      receive
  747: 	 {Ref, SslPid} ->
  748: 	     ok = apply_on_ssl_node(
  749: 		    NH2,
  750: 		    fun () ->
  751: 			    tstsrvr_format(
  752:                               "Hi from ~p!~n", [node()]),
  753: 			    SslPid ! {self(), ping},
  754: 			    receive
  755: 				{SslPid, pong} ->
  756: 				    ok
  757: 			    end
  758: 		    end)
  759:      end.
  760: 
  761: monitor_nodes_test(NH1, NH2, _) ->
  762:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
  763: 
  764:     Ref = make_ref(),
  765:     MonitorNodesFun =
  766:         fun() ->
  767:                 tstsrvr_format("Hi from ~p!~n", [node()]),
  768:                 ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, [nodedown_reason]),
  769:                 send_to_tstcntrl({self(), ready, Ref}),
  770:                 NodeUp = receive_any(),
  771:                 send_to_tstcntrl({self(), got, NodeUp}),
  772:                 NodeDown = receive_any(),
  773:                 send_to_tstcntrl({self(), got, NodeDown}),
  774:                 ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false, [nodedown_reason])
  775:         end,
  776:     spawn_link(fun () ->
  777:                        ok = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, MonitorNodesFun)
  778:                end),
  779:     {SslPid, ready, Ref} = receive_any(),
  780: 
  781:     %% Setup connection and expect 'nodeup'
  782:     pong = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> net_adm:ping(Node2) end),
  783:     {SslPid, got, {nodeup, Node2, []}} = receive_any(),
  784: 
  785:     %% Disconnect and expect 'nodedown' with correct reason
  786:     true = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () ->
  787:                                           net_kernel:disconnect(Node2)
  788:                                   end),
  789:     {SslPid, got, {nodedown, Node2, [{nodedown_reason, disconnect}]}} = receive_any(),
  790:     ok.
  791:

  949:     %% Check that the function ran on the client node.
  950:     [{verify_pass_always_ran, true}] =
  951:         apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, fun () -> ets:tab2list(verify_fun_ran) end),
  952:     %% Check that it ran on the server node as well.  The server
  953:     %% requested and verified the client's certificate because we
  954:     %% passed fail_if_no_peer_cert.
  955:     [{verify_pass_always_ran, true}] =
  956:         apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, fun () -> ets:tab2list(verify_fun_ran) end).

  959: get_socket_priorities() ->
  960:     [Priority ||
  961: 	{ok,[{priority,Priority}]} <-
  962: 	    [inet:getopts(Port, [priority]) || Port <- inet_ports()]].

  964: get_dist_util_fullsweep_option(Node) ->
  965:     SenderPid = proplists:get_value(Node, erlang:system_info(dist_ctrl)),
  966:     {links, Links1} = erlang:process_info(SenderPid, links),
  967:     {links, Links2} = erlang:process_info(whereis(net_kernel), links),
  968:     [DistUtilPid] = [X || X <- Links1, Y <- Links2, X =:= Y],
  969:     {garbage_collection, GCOpts} = erlang:process_info(DistUtilPid, garbage_collection),
  970:     proplists:get_value(fullsweep_after, GCOpts).
  971: 
  972: inet_ports() ->
  973:      [Port || Port <- erlang:ports(),
  974:               element(2, erlang:port_info(Port, name)) =:= "tcp_inet"].
  975: 
  976: start_ssl_node(Config) ->
  977:     start_ssl_node(Config, "").
  978: 
  979: start_ssl_node(Config, XArgs) ->
  980:     Name = mk_node_name(Config),
  981:     App = proplists:get_value(app_opts, Config),
  982:     SSLOpts = setup_tls_opts(Config),
  983:     start_ssl_node_name(
  984:       Name, App ++ " " ++ SSLOpts ++ " " ++ XArgs).
  985: 
  986: 
  987: mk_node_name(Config) ->
  988:     case proplists:get_value(node_name, Config) of
  989:         undefined ->
  990:             N = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
  991:             Case = proplists:get_value(testcase, Config),
  992:             Hostname =
  993:                 case proplists:get_value(hostname, Config) of
  994:                     undefined -> "";
  995:                     Host -> "@" ++ Host
  996:                 end,
  997:             atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  998:                 ++ "_"
  999:                 ++ atom_to_list(Case)
 1000:                 ++ "_"
 1001:                 ++ integer_to_list(N) ++ Hostname;
 1002:         Name ->
 1003:             Name
 1004:     end.
 1005: 
 1006: setup_certs(Config) ->
 1007:     {ok,Host} = inet:gethostname(),
 1008:     Extensions =
 1009:         {extensions,
 1010:          [#'Extension'{
 1011:              extnID = ?'id-ce-subjectAltName',
 1012:              extnValue = [{dNSName, Host}],
 1013:              critical = false}]},
 1014:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1015:     DerConfig =
 1016:         public_key:pkix_test_data(
 1017:           #{server_chain =>
 1018:                 #{root => [rsa_root_key(1), {digest,sha256}],
 1019:                   intermediates => [rsa_intermediate_conf(2)],
 1020:                   peer => [rsa_peer_key(3),  {digest, sha256}, Extensions]},
 1021:             client_chain =>
 1022:                 #{root => [rsa_root_key(1),  {digest, sha256}],
 1023:                   intermediates => [rsa_intermediate_conf(5)],
 1024:                   peer => [rsa_peer_key(6), {digest, sha256}, Extensions]}}),
 1025:     ClientBase = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa"]),
 1026:     ServerBase =  filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa"]),
 1027:     _  = x509_test:gen_pem_config_files(DerConfig, ClientBase, ServerBase).
 1028: 
 1029: setup_tls_opts(Config) ->
 1030:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1031:     SC = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_server_cert.pem"]),
 1032:     SK = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_server_key.pem"]),
 1033:     SCA = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_server_cacerts.pem"]),
 1034:     CC = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_client_cert.pem"]),
 1035:     CK = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_client_key.pem"]),
 1036:     CCA = filename:join([PrivDir, "rsa_client_cacerts.pem"]),
 1037: 
 1038:     case proplists:get_value(tls_only_basic_opts, Config, []) of
 1039:         [_|_] = BasicOpts -> %% No verify but server still need to have cert
 1040:             "-proto_dist inet_tls " ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_certfile " ++ SC ++ " "
 1041:                 ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_keyfile " ++ SK ++ " " ++ " -ssl_dist_opt client_verify verify_none " ++ BasicOpts;
 1042:         [] -> %% Verify
 1043:             TlsVerifyOpts = proplists:get_value(tls_verify_opts, Config, []),
 1044:              case TlsVerifyOpts of
 1045:                  [_|_] ->
 1046:                      "-proto_dist inet_tls "
 1047:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_certfile " ++ SC ++ " "
 1048:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_keyfile " ++ SK ++ " "
 1049:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_cacertfile " ++ SCA ++ " "
 1050:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_verify verify_peer "
 1051:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_fail_if_no_peer_cert true "
 1052:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt client_certfile " ++ CC ++ " "
 1053:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt client_keyfile " ++ CK ++ " "
 1054:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt client_cacertfile " ++ CCA ++ " "
 1055:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt client_verify verify_peer "
 1056:                          ++  TlsVerifyOpts;
 1057:                  _ ->  %% No verify, no extra opts
 1058:                      "-proto_dist inet_tls " ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_certfile " ++ SC ++ " "
 1059:                          ++ "-ssl_dist_opt server_keyfile " ++ SK ++ " " ++ "-ssl_dist_opt client_verify verify_none "
 1060:              end
 1061:     end.
 1062: 
 1063: %%
 1064: %% Start scripts etc...
 1065: %%
 1066: 
 1067: add_ssl_opts_config(Config) ->
 1068:     %%
 1069:     %% Start with boot scripts if on an installed system; otherwise,
 1070:     %% just point out ssl ebin with -pa.
 1071:     %%
 1072:     try
 1073: 	Dir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1074: 	LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
 1075: 	Apps = application:which_applications(),
 1076: 	{value, {stdlib, _, STDL_VSN}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib, 1, Apps),
 1077: 	{value, {kernel, _, KRNL_VSN}} = lists:keysearch(kernel, 1, Apps),
 1078: 	StdlDir = filename:join([LibDir, "stdlib-" ++ STDL_VSN]),
 1079: 	KrnlDir = filename:join([LibDir, "kernel-" ++ KRNL_VSN]),
 1080: 	{ok, _} = file:read_file_info(StdlDir),
 1081: 	{ok, _} = file:read_file_info(KrnlDir),
 1082: 	SSL_VSN = get_app_vsn(ssl),
 1083: 	VSN_CRYPTO = get_app_vsn(crypto),
 1084: 	VSN_ASN1 = get_app_vsn(asn1),
 1085: 	VSN_PKEY = get_app_vsn(public_key),
 1086: 
 1087: 	SslDir = filename:join([LibDir, "ssl-" ++ SSL_VSN]),
 1088: 	{ok, _} = file:read_file_info(SslDir),
 1089: 	%% We are using an installed otp system, create the boot script.
 1090: 	Script = filename:join(Dir, atom_to_list(?MODULE)),
 1091: 	{ok, RelFile} = file:open(Script ++ ".rel", [write]),
 1092:         io:format(RelFile,
 1093: 		  "{release, ~n"
 1094: 		  " {\"SSL distribution test release\", \"~s\"},~n"
 1095: 		  " {erts, \"~s\"},~n"
 1096: 		  " [{kernel, \"~s\"},~n"
 1097: 		  "  {stdlib, \"~s\"},~n"
 1098: 		  "  {crypto, \"~s\"},~n"
 1099: 		  "  {asn1, \"~s\"},~n"
 1100: 		  "  {public_key, \"~s\"},~n"
 1101: 		  "  {ssl, \"~s\"}]}.~n",
 1102: 		  [case catch erlang:system_info(otp_release) of
 1103: 		       {'EXIT', _} -> "R11B";
 1104: 		       Rel -> Rel
 1105: 		   end,
 1106: 		   erlang:system_info(version),
 1107: 		   KRNL_VSN,
 1108: 		   STDL_VSN,
 1109: 		   VSN_CRYPTO,
 1110:                    VSN_ASN1,
 1111: 		   VSN_PKEY,
 1112: 		   SSL_VSN]),
 1113: 	ok = file:close(RelFile),
 1114:         ?CT_LOG("Bootscript: ~p", [Script]),
 1115: 	case systools:make_script(Script, []) of
 1116:             ok ->
 1117:                 ok;
 1118:             NotOk ->
 1119:                 ?CT_PAL("Bootscript problem: ~p", [NotOk]),
 1120:                 erlang:error(NotOk)
 1121:         end,
 1122: 	[{app_opts, "-boot " ++ Script} | Config]
 1123:     catch
 1124: 	Class : Reason : Stacktrace ->
 1125:             ?CT_LOG("Exception while generating bootscript:~n~p",
 1126:                    [{Class, Reason, Stacktrace}]),
 1127: 	    [{app_opts, "-pa \"" ++ filename:dirname(code:which(ssl))++"\""}
 1128: 	     | add_comment_config(
 1129: 		 "Bootscript wasn't used since the test wasn't run on an "
 1130: 		 "installed OTP system.",
 1131: 		 Config)]
 1132:     end.
 1133: 
 1134: add_comment_config(Comment, []) ->
 1135:     [{comment, Comment}];
 1136: add_comment_config(Comment, [{comment, OldComment} | Cs]) ->
 1137:     [{comment, Comment ++ " " ++ OldComment} | Cs];
 1138: add_comment_config(Comment, [C|Cs]) ->
 1139:     [C|add_comment_config(Comment, Cs)].
 1140: 
 1141: 
 1142: success(Config) ->
 1143:     case lists:keysearch(comment, 1, Config) of
 1144: 	{value, {comment, _} = Res} -> Res;
 1145: 	_ -> ok
 1146:     end.

 1148: get_app_vsn(erts) ->
 1149:     erlang:system_info(version);
 1150: get_app_vsn(App) ->
 1151:     application:load(App),
 1152:     {ok, AppKeys} = application:get_all_key(App),
 1153:     proplists:get_value(vsn, AppKeys).
 1154: 
 1155: verify_fail_always(_Certificate, _Event, _State) ->
 1156:     %% Create an ETS table, to record the fact that the verify function ran.
 1157:     %% Spawn a new process, to avoid the ETS table disappearing.
 1158:     Parent = self(),
 1159:     spawn(
 1160:       fun() ->
 1161:               catch ets:delete(verify_fun_ran),
 1162: 	      ets:new(verify_fun_ran, [public, named_table]),
 1163: 	      ets:insert(verify_fun_ran, {verify_fail_always_ran, true}),
 1164: 	      Parent ! go_ahead,
 1165: 	      timer:sleep(infinity)
 1166:       end),
 1167:     receive go_ahead -> ok end,
 1168:     {fail, bad_certificate}.
 1169: 
 1170: verify_pass_always(_Certificate, _Event, State) ->
 1171:     %% Create an ETS table, to record the fact that the verify function ran.
 1172:     %% Spawn a new process, to avoid the ETS table disappearing.
 1173:     Parent = self(),
 1174:     spawn(
 1175:       fun() ->
 1176:               catch ets:delete(verify_fun_ran),
 1177: 	      ets:new(verify_fun_ran, [public, named_table]),
 1178: 	      ets:insert(verify_fun_ran, {verify_pass_always_ran, true}),
 1179: 	      Parent ! go_ahead,
 1180: 	      timer:sleep(infinity)
 1181:       end),
 1182:     receive go_ahead -> ok end,
 1183:     {valid, State}.
 1184: 
 1185: verify_tls(NH1, NH2) ->
 1186:     %% Verify that distribution protocol between nodes is TLS
 1187:     Node1 = NH1#node_handle.nodename,
 1188:     Node2 = NH2#node_handle.nodename,
 1189:     {ok,NodeInfo2} = apply_on_ssl_node(NH1, net_kernel, node_info, [Node2]),
 1190:     {ok,NodeInfo1} = apply_on_ssl_node(NH2, net_kernel, node_info, [Node1]),
 1191:     {address,#net_address{protocol = tls}} =
 1192:         lists:keyfind(address, 1, NodeInfo1),
 1193:     {address,#net_address{protocol = tls}} =
 1194:         lists:keyfind(address, 1, NodeInfo2),
 1195:     ok.
 1196: 
 1197: localhost_ip(InetVer) ->
 1198:     {ok, Addr} = inet:getaddr(net_adm:localhost(), InetVer),
 1199:     Addr.
 1200: 
 1201: localhost_ipstr(InetVer) ->
 1202:     {ok, Addr} = inet:getaddr(net_adm:localhost(), InetVer),
 1203:     Str = case InetVer of
 1204:               inet ->
 1205:                   io_lib:format("{~p,~p,~p,~p}", erlang:tuple_to_list(Addr));
 1206:               inet6 ->
 1207:                   io_lib:format("{~p,~p,~p,~p,~p,~p,~p,~p}", erlang:tuple_to_list(Addr))
 1208:           end,
 1209:     Qouted = case os:type() of
 1210:                  {win32, _} -> Str;
 1211:                  _ -> [$',Str,$']
 1212:              end,
 1213:     lists:flatten(Qouted).
 1214:

 1230: maybe_quote_tuple_list(String) ->
 1231:     case os:cmd("echo [{a,1}]") of
 1232:         "[{a,1}]"++_ ->
 1233:             String;
 1234:         _ ->
 1235:             %% Some shells need quoting of [{}]
 1236:             "'"++String++"'"
 1237:     end.
